text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Ben Arous | native_name = بن عروس | native_name_lang = aeb | other_name = | type = Governorate | image_skyline = | image_alt = | image_caption = | image_shield = | shield_alt = | image_map = Ben Arous in Tunisia.svg | map_alt = | map_caption = Map of Tunisia with Ben Arous highlighted | coordinates = | coor_pinpoint = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Tunisia | established_title = Created | established_date = December 3, 1983 | seat_type = Capital | seat = Ben Arous | government_footnotes = | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 761 | area_rank = Ranked 22nd of 24 | area_note = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 631842 | population_as_of = 2014 | population_rank = Ranked 6th of 24 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | population_note = | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +01 | postal_code_type = Postal prefix | postal_code = xx | area_code_type = Calling code | area_code = | iso_code = TN-13 | website = | footnotes = }} Ben Arous Governorate ( ) is one of the twenty-four governorates of Tunisia. It is in the northeastern part of the country. It covers an area of 761 km². As of 2014 census, 631,842 people lived there. Census 2014 (National Institute of Statistics) The capital is Ben Arous. == References == Category:1980s establishments in Tunisia Category:1983 establishments in Africa Category:Governorates of Tunisia
title: Ben Arous Governorate
